grade6easyquiz.title: Eyebrows
grade6easyquiz.content:
Eyebrows are part of the face which serve two purposes—for beauty and protection.
Eyebrows make the face look more beautiful by calling attention to the eyes. They make the eyes look healthier and brighter.
Eyebrows not only beautify the face but also protect the eyes from sweat. Without the eyebrows, drops of sweat may run into the eyes and blur the sight. Sweat in itself is poisonous and should be rid-off.

questions.question: The part of the body mentioned in the selection is the
They call attention to the
They make them look
Sweat can blur the sense of

vocabulary.meaning: The strip of hair growing on the ridge above a person's eye socket.
To make beautiful or more beautiful.

grade6easyquiz.title: Rain
grade6easyquiz.content:
It is raining
“It is raining hard,” said Lani.
The rain is falling on the houses.
The rain is falling on the trees.
There is water on the streets.
“I will not go to school today,” said Tita.
“I might catch cold.”

questions.question: Who will not go to school?
Why will she not go to school?
What filled the streets with water?
Where is the rain falling?
Why will Tita not go to school?

vocabulary.meaning: The process of water droplets falling from the sky.
The paved areas of a city, town, or village, typically including the road and sidewalks.

grade6easyquiz.title: HOW TO BE BIG AND STRONG
grade6easyquiz.content:
Berto is big and strong. He eats good breakfast before going to school. He drinks milk. He eats vegetables, too.
He plays in the yard. These things help Berto become big and strong.

questions.question: Who is the boy in the story?
Which one tells about him?
What does Berto eat before he goes to school?
What other things make Berto big and strong?
Where does Berto play?

vocabulary.meaning: The collection of planets and other celestial bodies that orbit the sun.
The ability to do work or cause change.

grade6easyquiz.title: OUR FRIENDS
grade6easyquiz.content:
I love to see the birds fly. I love to hear their pretty songs.
Birds are our friends. They eat harmful insects on our plants.
They are very pretty. They make us happy. We must be kind to birds.

questions.question: What do we love to see?
What do birds do?
What do we love to hear?
What do birds do for us?
How do birds help us?

vocabulary.meaning: Having or showing a friendly, generous, and considerate nature.
Small arthropod animals with a chitinous exoskeleton and three-part body.

grade6easyquiz.title: BUSY CHILDREN
grade6easyquiz.content:
It was Saturday. “Let us clean the house,” said Gloria.
“I will clean the yard,” said Nilo. “I will pull the grass. I will sweep the yard. I will burn the dry leaves.”
“I will water the plants,” said Lina.

questions.question: What day was it?
Who asked that they clean the house?
What will Nilo do?
options: He will help clean the house.

questions.question: What will Nilo do with the grass?
Who will water the plants?

vocabulary.meaning: Cause (a flame or fire) to spread.
An area of ground surrounded by walls or buildings.
